awd_titl_txt: III: Small: Collaborative Research: Comprehensive Heterogeneous Response Regression from Complex Data
awd_abstract_narration:
Predictive modeling is one fundamental problem in supervised machine learning. Traditional predictive modeling approaches typically built one predictor for each prediction task. However, in many real world problems, one needs to build predictors for multiple inter-correlated tasks simultaneously. For example, in real-time anesthesia decision making, the anesthesia drugs will have impact on multiple indicators of an anesthesia patient, such as anesthesia depth, blood pressures, heart rates, etc. The anesthesiologist needs to consider all those different aspects as well as their intrinsic dependence before s/he can make the decision. The goal of this project is to conduct systematic research on heterogeneous response regression, which builds multiple regression models for heterogeneous responses as well as exploring the relationship among them.

Specifically, the project's heterogeneous response regression framework is based on a tailored latent factor model that captures the relationship among different responses in a low-dimensional space. The response heterogeneity will be captured by utilizing the exponential family distributions and beyond. The model parameters can be learned through regularized maximum likelihood estimation via a majorization-minimization procedure. Moreover, a distributed solution based on the alternating direction method of multipliers can be derived to enhance the scalability. The project will also make the framework more flexible by (1) adding individualized effect terms to capture sample/feature heterogeneity and induce task dependency; and (2) leveraging a functional model to account for time-varying predictors and to make the prediction time-sensitive. The project will demonstrate the effectiveness of its method in disease risk prediction and financial stability modeling.

por.por_cntn:
This project has developed a range of methods, theories, and scalable computational tools to handle large-scale multivariate prediction tasks and association studies with various kinds of heterogeneous data. Such problems nowadays commonly arise in the fields of engineering and scientific research. The methods developed in this project have allowed us to gain essential insights in various real-world applications in healthcare, population health, genetics, and others. 

Throughout the project, we have developed a comprehensive heterogeneous response regression framework to leverage multiple learning tasks in the presence of data heterogeneities. First, we derive a general multivariate reduced-rank generalized linear model framework from analyzing heterogeneous outcomes belonging to the exponential-dispersion family. The resulting models are widely applicable when several types of related outcomes, including continuous measurements, binary indicators, discrete counts, are collected. This basic yet fundamental framework is then generalized in several fronts to utilize interpretable feature selection/extraction, robustification with outlier detection, structural constraints and uncertainties arising from data integration, heterogeneities due to clustered population, and longitudinal/functional data with time-varying association structures. With this project, dimension reduction and joint modeling techniques, such as sparse and low-rank methodologies, in particular, have been significantly advanced and better understood for scalable and interpretable learning of real-world heterogeneous data. 

The project has involved training of several Ph.D. students and resulted in many publications in leading statistical and machine learning journals and several computational packages.
